snippet: Rioters in a Palestinian neighborhood in Jerusalem destroyed two light-rail stations, breaking what some saw as an artery of coexistence in a city that is otherwise split.
abstract: Destruction of light-rail stations in Jerusalem by rioters in Palestinian neighborhoods, while a minor casualty compared with mounting death toll in Gaza, is still laden with symbolic meaning; rail was once celebrated, at least by Israeli Jews, as artery of coexistence in otherwise hostile, divided city.

byline.contributor: Irit Pazner Garshowitz and Carol Sutherland contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Rioters in a Palestinian neighborhood in Jerusalem destroyed two light-rail stations, breaking what some saw as an artery of coexistence in a city that is otherwise split.

headline.main: In Divided Jerusalem, Rail Line for Arabs and Jews Is Among the Fractures
headline.print_headline: In Divided Jerusalem, Rail Line for Arabs and Jews Is Among the Fractures
